• Benchmarked companies in the US and Costa Rica to identify best known methods in supporting a global company. 
• Implemented a robust assessment process used to determine what processes/roles could move to the new center. All of HR processes were assessed and a roadmap developed. 
• Successfully transitioned 65 positions/roles to the shared service center with no service interruptions. MFG Manager Intel Corporation 1989  –  2010  (21 years) HR Intel Corporation 2004  –  2009  (5 years) Global HR operations Manager Intel January 2005  –  January 2007  (2 years 1 month) Operations Manager responsible for all employee benefit related contacts and complex case resolution. 
• Managed US based employee benefits contact center and matrix managed centers in Europe and Asia. 
• Increased productivity by 40% while maintaining customer service goals by driving efficiencies and creating a global support model to meet organization’s objectives. 
• Facilitated a new support model, Customer Care, the highest touch point for employees. 
• Transitioned department to an off-shore site in Costa Rica. 
• Transformed data to value add by creating an automated score card, drove sustaining excellence in customer service, and enabled a seamless employee experience by improving the customer to contact center communication. Manufacturing Engineering Systems Dept Manager Intel Corporation 2002  –  2005  (3 years) Provided tactical support to factory operations, commodity spending reduction, supplier service and support, and functional Industrial Engineering support. 
• Created a cost culture that was implemented across the organization. 
• Facilitated a new Vision and Mission; creating a “One Generation Ahead Team “ to implement the new vision. 
• Supplier Vendor Management across the factory, managing logistics and tactical operations. 
• Implemented a robust safety program using the Safety Management by Walking Around which resulted in a safety culture throughout the organization. 
• Facilitated a team to reduce expenditures which resulted in ~22% reduction in commodities and headcount reduction. Manufacturing Dept Manager Intel 1997  –  2002  (5 years) Managed a department of ~1000 employees with 12 direct reports and budget responsibilities of 200M. 
• Factory ramped from green field start up to full production, meeting/exceeding production metrics. Ramped workforce to ~950 technicians, ensuring training and development plans were in place. 
• Facilitated a manager development program to bring more breadth in the organization by creating opportunities for employees to job rotate or shadow other managers. 
• Active member of the virtual factory, keeping processes and systems aligned within manufacturing to ensure product quality across the life cycle. 
• Facilitated the implementation of a “self sustaining technician” model that could perform maintenance on the tool as well as run production. 
• Sunset a factory while maintaining all production parameters through closure. Supervisor/Shift Manager/Operations Manager Intel Corporation 1987  –  1997  (10 years) Managed a shift of 10 managers and 200 technicians to meet safety requirements, production schedules, quality standards and cost. 
• Directed the professional and technical development of the management team. Partnered with Engineering to improve manufacturability. 
• Facilitated the merger of manufacturing and maintenance supervisors to one management body overseeing both production and maintenance activities. 
• Empowered teams to self manage by creating an atmosphere of accountability, ownership and results orientation. Production Aide/ Operator Signetics 1983  –  1987  (4 years) Production operator and production technician responsible to meet production targets. 
• Operated state of the art semi-conductor equipment. 
• Handled chemicals in all areas of the factory. Maintained all quartz ware using an automated vertical tube wash and manual horizontal bath. 
• Production maintenance associated with Diffusion furnaces and lithography equipment.
